content.description: Stand start on the southwest corner of the Doom boulder and move up using positive holds, and (potentially) some stem moves.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. The landing is fairly level.
content.location: The problem is on the southwest corner of the Doom Boulder. The down climb is on the east face.

content.description: Sit start on a positive ledge and move up the northwest arete. Top out at the lip and charge the slab.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. The landing isn't the worst but it's not the best in the area either.
content.location: The down climb is on the south corner of the face...it's probably a 5.6 down climb with some brittle rock in that corner, so be aware.

content.description: Squat start in the left center of the west face. Utilizing solid crimps, make your way up to the sloper lip and veer left to top out.
content.location: This croute starts in the left center of the west face. Reference pictures for exact location.

content.description: Stand start on the left side of the east face. Climb up the "chimney" and top out.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. There is a hole at the bottom of the problem that could cause pain if you slid into it.
content.location: This is located on the left side of the east face.

content.description: Starting on the obvious ramp of the east face, move up and top out. Reference photos for beta.
content.protection: Pads and a spotter. There is a hole on the right side of the east face. Be aware.
content.location: Start on the left side of the east face and move up the ramp. There is a more "scandalous" top out straight out, but a more user friendly top out just slight left.

content.description: Start on the ramp and move up 6 feet. Rock over and move straight up the slab to the top out.
content.location: Starts on the left side of the east face and moves to the center of that face before heading straight up. The down climb is just left of the problem.

content.description: Squat start on a sloper with a small jib for the right foot out and right. Move up through some slopers and pinches to the top.
content.protection: Pads help. The landing can be sloped if you happen to fall straight down. We had 3 pads.
content.location: This problem is on the southwest face of the Doom boulder. The down climb is on the east face down an obvious runnel in the face.

content.description:
Start in the middle of the west face and move up using a vertical rail and positive side pulls. From the lip, move left to the positive hold on the "scoop" feature.

If you choose to not move left and top out in the featureless scoop, this problems gets significantly harder...potentially in the V8-10 range.
content.location: There is a down slide/climb on the east side of the boulder. View pictures for more details.

content.description: Sit start on a sloper and move up. The crux is the first move and getting in a position to get your feet under you. The rock can become a little chossy at the top but it works!
content.protection: A couple of pads will work well.
content.location: Just right of Fluid Dynamics of a Loogie and on the Southwest corner/face. The down climb is on the east face runnel.
